stem: After trauma near the medial epicondyle, a patientâ€™s wrist deviates radially when attempting flexion. Which muscle is denervated?
rationale_correct: Ulnar nerve injury at the elbow denervates FCU; unopposed FCR pulls the wrist into radial deviation during attempted flexion.

rationale_distractors.B: FCR is median-innervated and becomes unopposed; it is not denervated in ulnar nerve injury.
rationale_distractors.C: Pronator teres (median) affects pronation, not radial deviation with wrist flexion.
rationale_distractors.D: ECU (radial) affects extension/ulnar deviation, not flexion pattern here.
rationale_distractors.E: APB is median-innervated thenar muscle; unrelated to this finding.

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb Lecture Notes. Sep 22, 2025.
